revised_title: Physiological Action of the Active Principle of the Seeds of Abrus precatorius (Jequirity)
tldr: The authors investigate the physiological action of the active principle, or globulin, found in the seeds of Abrus precatorius (Jequirity). They find that the globulin causes inflammation, oedema, and local ecchymosis when applied to the conjunctiva or injected subcutaneously, and can be fatal when a certain dose is reached. The study also reveals that the rapidity and intensity of the action are proportional to the quantity used.
